chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
items.plainText: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

items.text: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
items.plainText: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.

items.text: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
items.plainText: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

items.text: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
items.plainText: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

items.text: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
items.plainText: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

items.text: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
items.plainText: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.

items.text: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
items.plainText: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.

items.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
items.plainText: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.

items.text: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.
items.plainText: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.

items.text: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
items.plainText: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.

items.text: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
items.plainText: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

items.text: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
items.plainText: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

items.text: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
items.plainText: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.

items.text: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
items.plainText: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

items.text: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
items.plainText: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

items.text: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
items.plainText: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

items.text: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
items.plainText: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

items.text: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
items.plainText: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

items.text: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
items.plainText: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

items.text: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.
items.plainText: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.

items.text: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
items.plainText: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.

items.text: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
items.plainText: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.

items.text: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
items.plainText: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

items.text: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
items.plainText: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.

items.text: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
items.plainText: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.

items.text: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
items.plainText: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

items.text: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
items.plainText: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

items.text: In the multitude of people is the king's honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
items.plainText: In the multitude of people is the king's honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.

items.text: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
items.plainText: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

items.text: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.
items.plainText: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

items.text: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
items.plainText: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.

items.text: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
items.plainText: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

items.text: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
items.plainText: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.

items.text: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
items.plainText: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.

items.text: The king's favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
items.plainText: The king's favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
